result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam J Reiter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court sets restitution in the following amounts $1,030.00 payable to PNC Bank, $964.00 to Wells Fargo Bank, $299.00 to BMO Harris Bank

DNA sample and pay the surcharge as to Count 1 ONLY. Court waives all other costs, assessments and surcharges, defendant to make diligent efforts to pay in full the restitution ordered. Failure to pay restitution or DNA surcharge owed will result in a civil judgment. DOC to collect monetary sums/amount at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Consecutive to any other sentence

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after 5 (five) years of the sentence has been served.

superMiscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- No violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with any programs or treatment recommended by the agent.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random screens.
- No drugs without a valid prescription.
- Pay restitution in the amount of $1,030 to PNC Bank.
- Pay restitution in the amount of $964 to Wells Fargo Bank.
- Pay restitution in the amount of $299 to BMO Harris Bank.
- Seek/maintain full time employment.

supervisions.notes:
- Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Adam J Reiter

records.addlTxt:
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING commencing OCTOBER 28, 2015 received and filed. (54 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to INSTITUTION
Denying Request for Sentencing Modification, signed and filed
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for sentence modification.
Decision and Order Denying Request for Sentence Modification, signed and filed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. jbs
Defendant's pro se request to modify sentence.

Defendant Adam J Reiter in court with Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Adam J Reiter in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel submits school transcripts and article researched by defendant to the court.
State files victim impact statements with the court.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel, Amy K., June R., John R., and defendant. 
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Court sets Restitution in the following amounts:
Count 1:  $1,030 - PNC Bank
Count 2:  $ 964 - Wells Fargo Bank
Count 3:  $ 299 - BMO Harris Bank

As to Count 1:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  5 years, consecutive to any other sentence -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  3 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  2 years 

As to Count 2:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  5 years, consecutive to the sentence imposed as to Count 1;-  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  3 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  2 years 

As to Count 3:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  5 years, consecutive to the sentence imposed as to Count 2;-  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  3 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  2 years 

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program - after 5 (five) years of the sentence has been served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause
-  cooperate with any programs or treatment recommended by the agent
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  Random screens
-  No drugs without a valid prescription
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $1,030 to PNC Bank
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $ 964 to Wells Fargo Bank
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $ 299 to BMO Harris Bank
-  DNA sample and pay the surcharge - as to Count 1 only
-  Court waives all other costs, assessments and surcharges - defendant to make diligent efforts to pay in full the restitution ordered
-  Seek/Maintain full-time employment 
-  Failure to pay any restitution or DNA surcharge owed will result in a civil judgment

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms
Order to Produce

Defendant Adam J Reiter in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Adam J Reiter in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to all Counts:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED.  Case passed.  Case recalled without the defendant in court.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 19 on 10/28/2015 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Adam J Reiter in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Adam J Reiter in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. For reasons stated on the record, the Court granted the defense request for an adjournment. Court does not object to the defendant being released for the funeral as long as he is appropriately escorted. Case adjourned to Branch 22.   All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Adam J Reiter not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant Adam J Reiter not in court, in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Adam J Reiter in court with attorney Vincent Guimont for Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Adam J Reiter in custody.  Ron Dague for Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with P.N.C. BANK, WELLS FARGO BANK, BMO HARRIS BANK, JULISA Y., NICOLAS R., AND AGANES W.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Adam J Reiter in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Adam J Reiter in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
